attributes.action: grant the electorate the opportunity to vote in a national referendum whether the UK should accede to the new EU treaty, irrespective of whether the treaty involves real changes to the EU constitution.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The then Prime Minister promised a public vote on the proposed EU constitution in 2004.  
The question as to whether the new treaty is an "amending" rather than a "constitutional" treaty should be left to the commonsense of the British people as expressed by their vote in a national referendum.
While the decision on whether the UK should accede to the new treaty must be one for the Union Parliament, the granting of further UK sovereignty to the EU is a matter of such fundamental importance and principle, that the British people should be asked to give their view in a referendum.
